title.rendered: Israel Aid and Humanitarian Efforts in Gaza: July 9, 2024

content.rendered:
Aid Trucks Entry

331 aid trucks carrying humanitarian goods were transferred to Gaza yesterday. This included 275 trucks via the Kerem Shalom Crossing and 56 trucks via the Erez Crossing.

Fuel Transfers

6 tankers of cooking gas were transferred to Gaza for the operation of vital humanitarian infrastructure on July 8.

Airdrops

31 pallets (5.58 tons) of aid were airdropped over Gaza on July 8.

Aid Collection Status

70 aid trucks are awaiting collection on the Gazan side of the Erez Crossing, while 106 aid trucks were collected from the Gazan side of Kerem Shalom. Over 1,150 trucks are still waiting to be collected as of July 8.

Jordanian Route Coordination

50 aid trucks were coordinated via the Jordanian route.

Aid to Northern Gaza

50 aid trucks were coordinated to northern Gaza on July 8.

Medical Aid Initiatives

As part of our continuous efforts to facilitate responses in the medical field for the civilian population of Gaza, 30,000 vaccines for Diphtheria and Tetanus, donated by UNICEF, were transferred to Gaza yesterday (July 8). This is in addition to over 2 million vaccines for other diseases such as Whooping cough, Hepatitis B, Measles, Mumps, and Rubella, which were transferred to Gaza over the last few months.

Coordination Efforts

Out of 15 UN coordination requests, 13 were approved as of July 8.

Local Tactical Pause

Today, July 9, between 10:00 and 14:00, the IDF will pause operations in the Kezan Abor Shaun in Khan Younis to enable the movement of humanitarian aid.

This structured format with headings and paragraphs improves readability for a WordPress blog post, making it easier for readers to navigate through the different sections of information.

excerpt.rendered: 331 aid trucks delivered to Gaza, plus medical supplies coordinated.
